trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref> objects.
This class represents a collection of pairs, where each pair consists of a string serving as a collection key and a string value.
Because the first element is a key, it must be unique across the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection"></xref> class.
Adds a <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref> object to the collection based on the supplied parameters.
Use the <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection.Add%2A> method to add a new <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> object to the collection.
A <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref>.
Adds a <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref> object to the collection based on the supplied parameters.
A string specifying the key.
A string specifying the value.
Gets the keys to all items contained in the <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection"></xref> collection.
A string array.
Clears the <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection"></xref> collection.
When the <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection.Clear%2A> method is called, it removes all <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> objects from the collection.

When overridden in a derived class, the <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection.CreateNewElement"></xref> method creates a new <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref> object.
Override the <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection.CreateNewElement%2A> method to create custom <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> objects.
When a collection is loaded from the configuration file, the <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection.CreateNewElement%2A> method is called to create individual elements.

The <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection.CreateNewElement%2A> method must be overridden in classes that derive from the <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection> class.
A newly created <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref>.
Gets the element key for a specified configuration element when overridden in a derived class.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref> to which the key should be returned.
An object that acts as the key for the specified <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref> object based on the supplied parameter.

Use the <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection.Item%2A> property to get a <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> object in the collection based on the `key` parameter.
The key of the <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref> contained in the collection.
A configuration element, or `null` if the key does not exist in the collection.
Gets a collection of configuration properties.
A collection of configuration properties.
Removes a <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref> object from the collection.
A string specifying the key.

Gets a value indicating whether an attempt to add a duplicate <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref> object to the <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection"></xref> collection will cause an exception to be thrown.

`true` if an attempt to add a duplicate <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection"></xref> will cause an exception to be thrown; otherwise, `false`.
